title: Provides Data from SAMPLING Project
text: Loading package allows import datasets: Please read descriptions datasets reference section.
code: library(samplrData) head(sundh2023e3) #>    ID block trial #> 1 101     1     1 #> 2 101     1     2 #> 3 101     1     3 #> 4 101     1     4 #> 5 101     1     5 #> 6 101     1     6 #>                                                                                                                                   query #> 1     If the weather in England is mild on a random daywhat is the probability that the weather will also be not foggy on the same day? #> 2 If the weather in England is not thundery on a random daywhat is the probability that the weather will also be humid on the same day? #> 3                                     What is the probability that the weather will be  snowy or not stormy on a random day in England? #> 4 If the weather in England is not humid on a random daywhat is the probability that the weather will also be thundery on the same day? #> 5                                               What is the probability that the weather will be  not humid on a random day in England? #> 6                                                  What is the probability that the weather will be  stormy on a random day in England? #>                querydetail querytype estimate starttime endtime        RT #> 1     not foggy given mild    notAgB       90   1188820 1188860 39.329710 #> 2 humid given not thundery    BgnotA       50   1188860 1188878 18.635095 #> 3      snowy or not stormy   AornotB       90   1188879 1188925 46.462790 #> 4 thundery given not humid    AgnotB        5   1188925 1188956 30.659539 #> 5                not humid      notB       80   1188956 1188963  6.641129 #> 6                   stormy         B       20   1188963 1188971  8.111630

what: Data from Experiment 3 in Sundh et al. (2023) — sundh2023e3
title: Data from Experiment 3 in Sundh et al. (2023) — sundh2023e3
text: Participants made probability judgments format: “probability weather [X] random day England?". Various weather events used, queries included marginal events, conditional events, conjunctions, disjunctions. total set 20 unique queries formed block within presentation order randomized participant. experiment consisted three blocks, participants responded unique query three times.

title: Data from Experiment 3 in Sundh et al. (2023) — sundh2023e3
text: Sundh J, Zhu J, Chater N, Sanborn (2023). “Unified Explanation Variability Bias Human Probability Judgments: Computational Noise Explains Mean Variance Signature.” Journal Experimental Psychology: General, 152(10), 2842--2860. ISSN 1939-2222, 0096-3445, doi:10.1037/xge0001414 .
